com.defano.jmonet.tools.brushes

Class StampStroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.brushes.StampStroke
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stroke
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShapeStroke

    public abstract class StampStroke
extends Object
implements Stroke
    A stroke in which every point on the stroked shape's path can be stamped/marked independently. Useful for producing strokes that emulates a "pen" whose tip is of some arbitrary shape.

    • Method Detail

      • stampPoint

        public abstract void stampPoint(GeneralPath path,
                                Point point)
        Stamps a given point on a stroked shape's path.

        This method should append zero or more shapes to given the path, each of which represents the mark that the "pen" should leave at this point on the path. Typically, the stamped shape should be translated such that it's center- point is located at the given point.

        Parameters:
        path - A path of the stroked shape
        point - A point in the given path that should be stroked.

      • createStrokedShape

        public Shape createStrokedShape(Shape shape)
        Specified by:
        createStrokedShape in interface Stroke

      • getInterpolationInterval

        public int getInterpolationInterval()
        Gets the linear interpolation interval currently in use; a value less than 1 indicates that interpolation is disabled.
        Returns:
        The interpolation interval.

      • setInterpolationInterval

        public void setInterpolationInterval(int interval)
        Defines the linear interpolation interval used when stamping the stroke shape. An interval less than 1 disables interpolation.

        When interval is positive, every interval pixel on the stroked shape's path is stroked; when less than 1, only points returned by the shape's path iterator are stamped.

        For example, when disabled (interval=0), stroking a line shape will invoke stampPoint(GeneralPath, Point) only twice; at the start and end points of the line). When interval = 1, stroking the same line will invoke stampPoint(GeneralPath, Point) at every pixel on the line formed between the two points. When interval = 2, every other pixel will be stamped.

        Parameters:
        interval - Specifies every nth pixel between control points to stamp; value less than 1 stamps only control points.

      • getFlatness

        public double getFlatness()
        Gets the flatness used to render curved surfaces. See setFlatness(double).
        Returns:
        The current flatness; default is 1

      • setFlatness

        public void setFlatness(double flatness)
        Defines the flatness of curved segments of the stamped path. Smaller values produce smoother curves; larger values produce flatter, approximated curves. Smaller values produce a more complex stroked shape that will take longer to render.

        Curved portions of a stroked path are recursively "flattened" into linear sub-segments, such that the final path is comprised only of linear segments. This value defines the maximum length of any linear sub-segment on the final path.

        See FlatteningPathIterator.

        Parameters:
        flatness - The flatness, in pixels. Value must be greater than or equal to 0.
